metadata.title: CVE-2017-17501 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
WriteOnePNGImage in coders/png.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has a heap-based buffer over-read via a crafted file. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-17501` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.27-1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.27-1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.27-1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.27-1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.27-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.27-1').
